title: WHISPER SPEAKER IDENTIFICATION: LEVERAGING PRE-TRAINED MULTILINGUAL TRANSFORMERS FOR ROBUST SPEAKER EMBEDDINGS
author: Jakaria Islam Emon (Hokkaido Denshikiki Co., Ltd.), Md Abu Salek (Hokkaido Denshikiki Co., Ltd.), Kazi Tamanna Alam (Barisal Information Technology College), ...
relevance_why: The paper addresses speaker identification using a robust framework which could be applied to audio processing tasks in Haohe Liu's research on speech and audio enhancement.
background: Speaker identification in multilingual settings, where speakers may switch between different languages or dialects, is fundamentally challenging.
contribution: This paper introduces the Whisper Speaker Identification (WSI) framework to solve speaker identification challenges in multilingual contexts, achieving significant improvements in error rates.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focus on English data and often fail in multilingual settings.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages a pre-trained multilingual automatic speech recognition (ASR) model and combines joint loss optimization strategies to enhance speaker embedding robustness across languages.

key_innovation: The combination of leveraging a multilingual pre-trained encoder with joint loss optimization approaches is unique, improving speaker identification performance significantly.
real_world_impact: The method enhances speaker identification accuracy in real-world multilingual scenarios, potentially benefiting applications in voice recognition technology and automated customer service.
limitations: The use of zero-padding increases computational overhead, which may not be ideal for real-time applications.

new_terms.normalized temperature-scaled cross entr: **Normalized Temperature-scaled Cross Entropy (nt-xent)** is a contrastive loss function designed to enhance embeddings by enforcing similarities between positive pairs and dissimilarities between negative pairs during training.
